IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: SUPPORT OF THE JOHN SEALY HOSPITAL / UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS MEDICAL BRANCH AT GALVESTON (UTMB).
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROVIDE FOR THE CONSTRUCTION, REMODELING, EQUIPPING, AND FURNISHING OF THE JOHN SEALY HOSPITAL AND OTHER HOSPITAL BUILDING OR BUILDINGS IN THE CITY OF GALVESTON, TX, IN CONNECTION WITH THE JOHN SEALY HOSPITAL, AND TO PROVIDE FOR HEALTHCARE OF CITIZENS OF GALVESTON THEREIN.
IRS990.Desc: EXPENDITURES TO SUPPORT THE JOHN SEALY HOSPITAL / UTMB - GALVESTON. SEE SCHEDULE I.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: UTMB, THE SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION, IS NOT REQUIRED TO OBTAIN RECOGNITION OF ITS PUBLIC CHARITY STATUS SINCE IT IS A GOVERNMENTAL UNIT DESCRIBED IN IRC 107(B)(1)(A)(V). HOWEVER, THE ORGANIZATION HAS A COPY OF A LETTER, DATED OCTOBER 9, 1997, FROM THE IRS ACTING DISTRICT DIRECTOR STATING THAT THE UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS SYSTEM AND ALL OF ITS COMPONENT INSTITUTIONS, INCLUDING THE UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS MEDICAL BRANCH AT GALVESTON ("UTMB"), ARE DESCRIBED IN SECTIONS 170(B)(1)(A)(V) AND 107(C)(1) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE.

LEADERS FROM THE ORGANIZATION AND UTMB MEET ON A REGULAR BASIS TO DISCUSS UTMB'S ONGOING PROJECTS AND NEEDS. UTMB'S PRESIDENT REGULARLY ATTENDS THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS' MEETINGS. THE ORGANIZATION'S EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR MEETS OR SPEAKS WITH UTMB'S PRESIDENT OR OTHER EXECUTIVES AT LEAST MONTHLY IF NOT MORE. FURTHER, MEMBERS OF THE ORGANIZATION'S STAFF FREQUENTLY MEET OR SPEAK WITH OTHER UTMB LEADERS AND/OR STAFF EACH WEEK ON A VARIETY OF MATTERS THAT ARE IMPORTANT TO UTMB, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE PROPERTIES THAT THE ORGANIZATION MANAGES FOR UTMB AND THE GRANTS THAT THE ORGANIZATION MAKES TO UTMB. THE ORGANIZATION AND UTMB HAVE MAINTAINED A CLOSE AND CONTINUOUS WORKING RELATIONSHIP FOR OVER NINETY (90) YEARS, WHICH ALLOWS THE ORGANIZATION TO BE RESPONSIVE TO UTMB'S NEEDS AND REQUESTS. THE ORGANIZATION'S INVESTMENT DECISIONS ARE INFLUENCED BY THE GRANT REQUESTS IT RECEIVES FROM UTMB. UTMB, A GOVERNMENTAL ENTITY, IS THE ONLY CHARITABLE ORGANIZATION OR SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION TO WHICH THE ORGANIZATION MAKES GRANTS. MANY OF THE GRANTS THE ORGANIZATION MAKES TO UTMB ARE FOR LARGE CAPITAL EXPENDITURES. LEADERS OF UTMB MEET WITH THE ORGANIZATION THROUGHOUT THE YEAR TO DISCUSS THE NEED FOR GRANTS AND THEIR TIMING WHICH ALLOWS THE ORGANIZATION TO CHOOSE INVESTMENTS BASED ON UTMB'S GRANT NEEDS.

THE ORGANIZATION IS A SUPPORTING ORGANIZATION TO UTMB, A GOVERNMENTAL ENTITY. THE ORGANIZATION WAS FORMED IN 1922 AND SINCE THAT TIME HAS MAINTAINED A CONTINUING AND HISTORIC RELATIONSHIP WITH UTMB. THE ORGANIZATION HAS CONTRIBUTED ALMOST 900 MILLION TO SUPPORT MEDICAL EDUCATION AND THE DELIVERY OF HEALTHCARE AT UTMB, INCLUDING FUNDING FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF UTMB'S HOSPITALS, ITS BIO-SAFETY LAB AND STATE-OF-THE- ART MEDICAL EQUIPMENT. THE ORGANIZATION IS ALSO THE LARGEST, SINGLE ENTITY CONTRIBUTOR TO A UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS SYSTEM INSTITUTION. THE ORGANIZATION, TOGETHER WITH UTMB, HAS PROVIDED THE VISION AND STRATEGIC DIRECTION THAT ALLOWS UTMB TO SERVE GALVESTON, THE STATE OF TEXAS AND THE NATION AS A PREMIER HEALTH INSTITUTION. THE ORGANIZATION AND UTMB'S LEADERS MEET ON A REGULAR BASIS TO DISCUSS UTMB'S ONGOING PROJECTS AND NEEDS. AS PREVIOUSLY STATED, THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD MEETS AND CONSIDERS UTMB'S NEEDS WHEN MAKING INVESTMENT DECISIONS. THE ORGANIZATION ENGAGES IN MANY CHARITABLE ACTIVITIES ON BEHALF OF UTMB. FOR EXAMPLE, THE ORGANIZATION OWNS PROPERTY AND BUILDINGS THAT UTMB USES FOR ITS CHARITABLE AND EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES. THE ORGANIZATION OWNS, MAINTAINS AND MANAGES SEVERAL OF THESE PROPERTIES AND WORKS WITH UTMB TO ENSURE THAT THE UPKEEP OF THESE PROPERTIES MEETS UTMB'S EXPECTATIONS. FOR INSTANCE, THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES THREE PATIENT CARE FACILITIES AT NO COST, INCLUDING INSURANCE COVERAGE AND MAINTENANCE OF THE EXTERIOR ENVELOPE / GROUNDS OF THE PROPERTIES AND MAJOR COMPONENTS SUCH AS EXTERIOR CLIMATE CONTROL EQUIPMENT. THESE PROPERTIES INCLUDE THE PRIMARY CARE PAVILION, R. WAVERLEY SMITH PAVILION AND UTMB OPHTHALMOLOGY CLINIC. DURING 2015, THE ORGANIZATION BEGAN PROVIDING, AT NO COST TO UTMB, FACILITIES ON CAMPUS FOR PARKING, INCLUDING A PARKING GARAGE AND PARKING LOT. ALSO IN 2015, THE UTMB HUMAN RESOURCES OFFICES WERE FINALIZED. LOCATED IN A BUILDING OWNED BY THE ORGANIZATION, OCCUPANCY OF THESE OFFICES IS PROVIDED AT NO EXPENSE TO UTMB. THE ORGANIZATION COORDINATED AND PAID FOR THE BUILDOUT OF UTMB'S HUMAN RESOURCES OFFICES BY PROVIDING THE ARCHITECT AND CONTRACTOR FOR THE PROJECT. MOREOVER, THE ORGANIZATION'S LEADERS AND STAFF MET SEVERAL TIMES WITH UTMB'S PRESIDENT AND SENIOR STAFF TO DISCUSS THE SCOPE OF THE JOHN SEALY HOSPITAL RENOVATION PROJECT. THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE REFURBISHING THE BUILDING FACADE AND EXPANSION AND MODERNIZATION OF THE PATIENT ROOMS WITHIN THE HOSPITAL. A GRANT OF 75,000,000 HAS BEEN APPROVED FOR THIS PROJECT. THIS PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN IN 2016.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: THE UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS MEDICAL BRA

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAINTAINS RECORDS OF THE GRANTS IT AWARDS TO UTMB AND MONITORS SUCH GRANTS BY (1) REQUIRING UTMB TO SIGN A WRITTEN GRANT AGREEMENT FOR MONETARY AWARDS; (2) CONDUCTING FIELD INVESTIGATIONS OF HOW UTMB WILL USE THE GIFT; (3) MEETING WITH UTMB OFFICERS AND PERSONNEL WHO WILL OVERSEE THE GRANT; AND (4) REQUESTING UTMB TO PROVIDE PROGRESS REPORTS, INCLUDING AMOUNT OF FUNDS EXPENDED ON THE PROJECT AS DRAWS ON THE GRANT ARE REQUESTED. BECAUSE THE ORGANIZATION AND UTMB HAVE A HISTORICALLY CLOSE WORKING RELATIONSHIP, THE ORGANIZATION CAN MAKE SURE THAT IT IS RESPONSIVE TO UTMB WHILE GUARANTEEING THAT GRANTS TO UTMB ARE USED CONSISTENTLY WITH ITS CHARITABLE PURPOSES.

WAVERLEY SMITH PAVILION OPERATING EXPENSES 212,909 UTMB OPHTHALMOLOGY CLINIC OPERATING EXPENSES 40,340 WEST END CLINIC PROPERTY PLANNING EXPENSES 84,441 UTMB PARKING LOT & GARAGE 59,117 OTHER REAL ESTATE UTILIZED BY UTMB

TO PROVIDE FOR THE CONSTRUCTION, REMODELING, EQUIPPING, AND FURNISHING OF THE JOHN SEALY HOSPITAL AND OTHER HOSPITAL BUILDING OR BUILDINGS IN THE CITY OF GALVESTON, TX, IN CONNECTION WITH THE JOHN SEALY HOSPITAL, AND TO PROVIDE FOR HEALTHCARE OF CITIZENS OF GALVESTON THEREIN.
A COPY OF THE FOUNDATION'S FORM 990 IS FURNISHED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO BEING FILED.
THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS REVIEWED ANNUALLY DURING THE JANUARY BOARD OF DIRECTORS MEETING AND A WRITTEN ACKNOWLEDGEMENT IS COMPLETED BY EACH DIRECTOR.

ANNUALLY THE ORGANIZATION'S INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE COMPENSATION OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND OFFICERS. THE COMMITTEE USES COMPARABLE DATA FROM VARIOUS NONPROFIT PUBLICATIONS, INCLUDING THE COUNCIL ON FOUNDATIONS SALARY AND BENEFIT REPORT, WHICH PROVIDES COMPENSATION DATA. IT ALSO USES OTHER NONPROFITS' FORMS 990. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND OTHER OFFICERS DO NOT PARTICIPATE IN THE CONVERSATIONS AND DISCUSSIONS ABOUT THEIR OWN COMPENSATION. DETAILED MINUTES OF THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE'S MEETINGS ARE MAINTAINED BY THE ORGANIZATION.

ANNUALLY THE ORGANIZATION'S INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE COMPENSATION OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND OFFICERS. THE COMMITTEE USES COMPARABLE DATA FROM VARIOUS NONPROFIT PUBLICATIONS, INCLUDING THE COUNCIL ON FOUNDATIONS SALARY AND BENEFIT REPORT, WHICH PROVIDES COMPENSATION DATA. IT ALSO USES OTHER NONPROFITS' FORMS 990. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND OTHER OFFICERS DO NOT PARTICIPATE IN THE CONVERSATIONS AND DISCUSSIONS ABOUT THEIR OWN COMPENSATION. DETAILED MINUTES OF THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE'S MEETINGS ARE MAINTAINED BY THE ORGANIZATION.

THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND AUDIT REPORT AVAILABLE TO ITS SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION, THE JOHN SEALY HOSPITAL AND THE UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS MEDICAL BRANCH (UTMB). UPON REASONABLE WRITTEN REQUEST, THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC.
